text: A Girl from Mogadishu is a Irish-Belgium film. It is a somewhat fictionalized story based on the testimony of Ifrah Ahmed, who having escaped war-torn Somalia, emerged as one of the world’s foremost international activists against gender-based violence. Filming in Belgium commenced October 18th, 2017 and was completed in Ireland and Morocco. The film stars Aja Naomi King as Ifrah, Martha Cango Antonio, Barkhad Abdi, and Maryam Mursals. ==Plot== Born into a refugee camp in war-torn Somalia, Ifrah is trafficked to Ireland as a teenager. Recounting her traumatic childhood experiences of female genital mutilation when applying for refugee status, she is re-traumatised and vows to devote her life to the eradication of the practice. Taking her campaign all the way to the President of Ireland and finally to the European Parliament and United Nations. A Girl from Mogadishu celebrates the power of testimony, for when women find the courage to stand-up, speak out, and tell their truth, the impact can be so inspiring and empowering that act as a meaningful catalyst for change. ==Production== The film is a Pembridge (Ireland) and Umedia (Belgium) production, with production services provided by Dune Film Productions in Morocco. Post-production took place at Windmill Pictures, Dublin and UMedia VFX, Brussels. Principal photography began in Belgium in October 2017. The film was also shot in Dublin and Morocco in 2018. ==Cast== *Aja Naomi King as Ifrah Ahmed *Martha Canga Antonio as Amala *Barkhad Abdi as Hassan *Luke Spencer Roberts as NGO Rep *Maryam Mursal as Grandmother *Ken Ndiaye as Father *Maggie O'Kane as Catherine Riley *Niall Buggy as Michael D. Higgins ==References== ==External links== * Category:Upcoming films Category:2010s biographical drama films Category:Belgian biographical drama films Category:English-language films Category:Films set in Somalia Category:Films set in Ireland Category:Films shot in Morocco Category:Films shot in the Republic of Ireland Category:Films shot in Belgium Category:Belgian films
title: A Girl from Mogadishu
